title: Slow Cooker Pork, Sauerkraut, and Beer Recipe
description: The simplicity of this slow cooker recipe belies the rich flavors you will get from the pork, sauerkraut, beer, onion, and sugar.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Slow Cooker Pork, Sauerkraut, and Beer 4.6 (17) 15 Reviews 5 Photos A family slow cooker favorite with pork, sauerkraut, and beer that's easy to put together. The beer enhances the flavor of the sauerkraut and pork. There is no need to brown the pork roast before placing it in the slow cooker. I serve this with scalloped or mashed potatoes. Submitted by Bobettern Updated on January 10, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 8 hrs 15 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings cooking spray 1 (2 pound) boneless pork loin roast salt and ground black pepper to taste 1 (32 ounce) jar sauerkraut, drained and rinsed ½ (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle light beer ¼ cup lightly packed brown sugar 1 small onion, diced 1 tablespoon butter, or more to taste, cut into small pieces Directions Gather the ingredients. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Prepare the crock of a five-quart slow cooker with cooking spray. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Season roast with salt and pepper; lay in the prepared slow cooker crock. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Spread sauerkraut over and around the roast. Pour beer over the sauerkraut. Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over the sauerkraut; top with onion and dot with butter. Season everything with salt and pepper. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard Cook on Low for 8 hours. Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard I Made It Print 45 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker Pork, Sauerkraut, and Beer 01 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes/Karen Hibbard 02 of 05 Photo by  CozyCurd4915 02/28/2024 Missing something We're not big sauerkraut fans, but decided to give this recipe a try. For me, the pork lacked flavor so I wish I had read some of the suggestions that were made in other reviews before attempting. If I made it again, I would sear the roast on each side to add flavor before placing it in the pot. I would also increase the amount of brown sugar to cut a little more of the sourness I tasted in the pork - adding apples, as others have done, sounds like a great idea, too. 03 of 05 Photo by  Kim Taylor 01/01/2017 Made with 1/2 bottle Angry Orchard hard cider and put the other half to good use washing it down later :-) Started later in the day, cooked on low for 4 hours, and on high for the final hour.
